title: Augmented Reality-Based Language Learning Design: Applying the SAM I Model and Threshold Concepts Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and secondary education field experience
context.additional_context: A course for in-service secondary teachers to enhance their language curriculum design capabilities in corporate educational settings, with a focus on designing augmented reality (AR) learning activities using personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Learners apply the three stages of the SAM I model (preparation, iterative design, development) to design an AR-based language learning module.
Learners meaningfully integrate core concepts of language subjects into AR activities using a threshold concepts framework.
Learners analyze formative assessment data to improve an AR learning design prototype.

resources: LMS platform (Zoom webinar, LMS publishing features)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
